short_summary: DNA sequencing for 2,460 samples to determine microbiome communities and impact of regenerative agriculture practices
description: Solicitation for competitive tender to provide DNA sequencing services to support two projects related to carbon sequestration and regenerative agriculture practices.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Solicitation Number
01R11-24-C074

#### Tender Title
DNA Sequencing Services for the Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada’s Lethbridge Research and Development Centre

#### Publication Date
January 19, 2024

#### Tender Closing Date
February 19, 2024 at 12:00 PM (noon)

#### Contracting Entity
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada

#### Procurement Category
SRV (Services)

#### Solicitation Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

#### Goods or Services Required
The successful contractor will provide DNA sequencing services for microbial community structure and community function. The scope of work includes:

* Sequencing of 2,460 DNA samples using amplicon sequencing and shotgun metagenomics
* A minimum of two phases of work, with the first phase to be completed by March 31, 2024, and the second phase by June 30, 2024
* The contractor may be required to provide additional sequencing for up to 2,460 DNA samples each year for two optional years

#### Bidding Instructions
A mandatory technical meeting will be held on February 19, 2024, to answer questions and provide further information. Bidders must submit their bids electronically through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS).

#### Evaluation Criteria
The request for proposal will be evaluated based on the required documents and the tender price.

#### Contact Information
For more information, please contact:
Melissa Smith
Contracting Specialist
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
Western Service Centre
300 – 2010 12th Avenue
Regina, SK  S4P 0M3
Telephone: 306-515-4796
Email: [melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca](mailto:melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca)

#### Notice of Amendment
This solicitation is subject to amendments and updates. It is the bidder's responsibility to regularly consult the GETS website for the most up-to-date information.

#### Integrity Regime
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. The successful contractor will be expected to comply with the Integrity Regime and its provisions.

#### Indigenous Procurement
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada encourages Indigenous-owned businesses to participate in this solicitation. For more information, please visit the Indigenous Business Directory website.
